intro: Panicum acostia, commonly known as the Acosta panicgrass, is a species of grass native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
